meanings.definition: To refuse or reject an offer or invitation.
meanings.sent1: I had to turndown the job offer because it required too much travel.
meanings.sent2: She always turndown invitations to parties because she prefers staying home.
meanings.sent3: When offered a second slice of cake, he had to turndown with a polite smile.
meanings.sent4: The cat seemed to turndown the new brand of food, walking away from the bowl.
meanings.sent5: His decision to turndown the promotion surprised everyone at the office.

meanings.definition: A decrease in volume or intensity.
meanings.sent1: The turndown of the music made it easier to focus on studying.
meanings.sent2: The turndown of the lights signaled the end of the performance.
meanings.sent3: The sudden turndown in temperature caught us off guard during the picnic.
meanings.sent4: The turndown of customer complaints showed the success of the new product.
meanings.sent5: The turndown of the party chatter indicated it was time to go home.

meanings.definition: The act of folding or turning over a part of something, such as a collar.
meanings.sent1: She neatly did the turndown of the bedsheet before getting into bed.
meanings.sent2: The turndown of the book's page corner helped her remember where she left off.
meanings.sent3: His turndown of the shirt collar gave him a more casual look.
meanings.sent4: The turndown of the envelope flap revealed a beautifully written letter inside.
meanings.sent5: The turndown of the napkin at the restaurant added an elegant touch to the table setting.
